unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbusters: Why You Should Dive into Film Festivals
normalised: Beyond the Blockbusters: Why You Should Dive into Film Festivals

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been binge-watching a lot of Netflix lately? Don't get me wrong, I love a good Shah Rukh Khan rom-com as much as the next person (Devdas still gets me!), but sometimes you need a little something… different. And that's where film festivals come in.
normalised: Hey everyone! Been binge-watching a lot of Netflix lately? Don't get me wrong, I love a good Shah Rukh Khan rom-com as much as the next person (Devdas still gets me!), but sometimes you need a little something… different. And that's where film festivals come in.

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a delicious biryani compared to a microwaved ready-meal. They offer a richer, more diverse flavour of cinema, showcasing films you wouldn't normally find in your local PVR. We're talking independent films, documentaries that blow your mind, and short films that pack a serious emotional punch.

unnormalised: Here in India, we're lucky to have some amazing film festivals. I'm thinking of the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) held annually in Goa. It's a huge deal, showcasing both Indian and international films. But don't think it's all about the big names and red carpets. Many smaller, more niche festivals are popping up all over the country. Think regional cinema, student films, or even festivals dedicated to specific genres.

unnormalised: Why should you consider attending one? Well, for starters, you'll discover incredible talent. You might just stumble upon the next Anurag Kashyap before they’re even a household name! It's a fantastic opportunity to support independent filmmakers and learn about different cultures and perspectives. Plus, the Q&A sessions with directors and actors are super insightful. You get a real peek behind the curtain.

unnormalised: Besides the films, the atmosphere at a film festival is electric. It's a gathering of film lovers, creators, and industry professionals. You can strike up conversations, network, and maybe even pitch your own film idea!
normalised: Besides the films, the atmosphere at a film festival is electric. It's a gathering of film lovers, creators, and industry professionals. You can strike up conversations, network, and maybe even pitch your own film idea!

unnormalised: So, ditch the usual multiplex for a weekend and explore the world of film festivals. Many offer student discounts and affordable passes. You might just find your new favourite film – and a whole new appreciation for the art of cinema! Check out your local listings, or search online for "film festivals near me." You never know, the next big thing might be showing just a few km away. And who knows, you might even spot a Bollywood star like Alia Bhatt attending the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival!
